questions.question: On the document object, what function will target a specific id?
questions.description: getElementById targets a specific id on a page. In jQuery, $('#idName') is used.

questions.question: You can display data in the console using the what method.
questions.description: The console.log method allows you to display data in the console.

questions.question: In JavaScript, what would 3 * (5 + 2)?
questions.description: JavaScript follows the order of operations.

questions.question: To create a multi-line comment in JavaScript, start with what?
questions.description: Multi-line comments start with /* and end with */.

questions.question: The modulus operator shows you what is left over from an arthimetic operation. What is the symbol?
questions.description: The modulus operator shows what is left over from an arthimetic operation. One use of it can determine if a number is even or odd.

questions.question: How do you take a number to some power? Using the Math object, what is the function?
questions.description: Math.pow will take a number to some power.

questions.question: How do you find a square root of some number? Using the Math object, what is the function?
questions.description: Math.sqrt will give you the square root of a number.

questions.question: Math.random will return a number between 0 and what?
questions.description: Math.random returns a number between 0 and 1, such as .2.

questions.question: How do you force a number to round down? Using the Math object, what is the function?
questions.description: Math.floor will round a number down. An example is Math.floor(4.75) will return 4.

questions.question: How do you force a number to round up? Using the Math object, what is the function?
questions.description: Math.ceil will round a number up. An example is Math.ceil(8.1) will return 9.

questions.question: What type is true?
questions.description: Both true and false are booleans. An example is (2 < 9) would return true.

questions.question: What function makes a string uppercase?
questions.description: toUppercase is used to make a string uppercase.

questions.question: What function removes and returns the last element in an array?
questions.description: pop removes and returns the last element in an array.

questions.question: What function adds an element to the end of an array?
questions.description: push adds an element to the end of an array.

questions.question: What function removes and returns the first element of an array?
questions.description: shift removes and returns the first element of an array.

questions.question: What function adds an element to the beginning of an array?
questions.description: unshift adds an element to the beginning of an array.

questions.question: What function allows you to concatenate two arrays together?
questions.description: concat allows you to concatenate two arrays together.

questions.question: What function allows you to return a copy of a portion of an array?
questions.description: slice allows you to return a copy of a portion of an array.

questions.question: What function allows you to alter an array by adding or removing elements?
questions.description: .splice allows you to alter an array by adding or removing elements.

questions.question: What function allows you to reverse an array?
questions.description: .reverse allows you to reverse an array.

questions.question: What function allows you to sort the elements in an array?
questions.description: sort allows you to sort the elements in an array.

questions.question: What function allows you to take an array and combine the elements together as a string?
questions.description: join allows you to take an array and join the elements together as a string.
